Description: Mellow restaurant serving sushi, creative rolls & other Japanese fare in functional surroundings.

summary.snippet: "The food was very scrumptious 😋 scraped the bowl of curry dry 😁"
"I ordered 4 spicy Tuna rolls & the poor quality was carried over in ALL 4 rolls."
"The ambience was great and the service was fantastic--very attentive staff."

most_relevant.description:
It was a pleasant experience dining here. I particularly liked the cleanliness of their place along with the service.
I ordered bibimbap, which was very nice, served with three separate types of kimchi. One can mix the gochujang sauce as much as you'd like. We ordered multiple sushi dishes. All of them were exceptionally good. Their Udon is awesome probably better than the ramen. I'm still a bit conservative about the sashimi. Overall I am pretty satisfied.

Worst restaurant in Ann Arbor. The chicken tastes off… it tastes gamely… and a weird taste. They can’t even figure out how to light up the fire for Budae-jjigae. They don’t know how to change it. And they even switched it with an empty one. Heaven knows how they organize the items they’re gonna to discard. They can’t tell the new ones from the used ones.

Korean food in A2 is a very competitive business and this is one more fantastic option, but one of the only on the north side of town. Ordered the Yukgaejang, which could've been even spicier, but was wholesome and wonderful as is.

Friday evening, not too busy. My wife got BBQ and I got the hot bowl bibimbap. Both were excellent. The staff were kind and friendly. Even more so when they found out that my wife is from Korea and I can speak Korean. The prices are reasonable and the side dishes are unlimited. Coming back again with Korean friends when they come through or other friends when they are curious about Korean flavors.

My daughter wanted Asian cuisine for her birthday so we drove to   Nagomi sushi and Korean BBQ  in Michigan. The restaurant wasn't busy at the time we went. The decor of the restaurant was nice  The spices and flavors of the different dishes delicious and the meats are cooked well.  Portions size was ok  and the cost a little high but that's to be expected. We order, chicken curry, katsu chicken curry, Nabeyaki, Tonkotsu, fried wings, Nagomi speciality wings, yum yum sushi, rainbow sushi, crab,shrimp sushi and donburi katsu.

Solid Korean food. Great Kalbi Tang (4.5/5). Great Yuk-hae (4.5/5). Good Curry Katsu (3.5/5). Cheap Takoyaki ($5 for 6). Some of their Japanese food is really bad tho: last time I ordered the Tonkotsu Ramen and it was absolutely disgusting (1/5). Tastes like a hodgepodge and nothing like Ramen.

I ordered takeout, 2 shrimp tempura rolls and vegetable tempura appetizer, from Nagomi on a weekday. My order was ready in about 15 minutes. The food was fresh and flavorful. I really liked the vegetable tempura and was surprised that broccoli was included in addition to the typical onion, potato, and carrot. The veggies or at least the broccoli were so soft and I think they are perhaps precooked prior to frying. I recommend the tempura appetizer for people to share as there was enough to share with another person. The shrimp tempura roll was just as I expected. Nagomi is a new place that I will be adding to my list of places to pick up lunch while working in Ann Arbor. I want to try other dishes as there are a lot of yummy options. The restaurant has ample seating to accommodate multiple small groups and large groups.

Oh my goodness, you MUST eat here! The food is so delicious and the service is great. We have never dined at a Korean restaurant before and it was a great experience. I can't tell you the names of the dishes we had, but they were very good. We also ordered sushi which came out quickly and was also very tasty. Their ramen was rich and wonderful and yum and I'm running out of adjectives to describe how good their food is. Mark Nagomi down on the "just go and enjoy" list.
